articles.author: Tatiana Bautzer, Lananh Nguyen
articles.description: When Ted Pick takes over as the new CEO of Morgan Stanley (MS.N) next week, the three-decade bank veteran's frank manner and steady hand will help him steer the firm through a dealmaking slump.
articles.title: Morgan Stanley's straight-talking new CEO Ted Pick taking charge

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Chinese smartphone maker Xiaomi (1810.HK) took the wraps off its first electric vehicle on Thursday and promptly announced it was aiming to become one of world's top five automakers.
articles.title: China's Xiaomi unveils first electric vehicle, plans to become top automaker

articles.author: Yuka Obayashi
articles.description: Oil prices steadied on Thursday after falling sharply in the previous session, as concerns eased about shipping disruptions along the Red Sea route even as tensions in the Middle East continued to rise.
articles.title: Oil prices stabilise as Red Sea transport disruptions ease

articles.author: Chen Chen Lin
articles.description: Singapore households are bracing for a sales tax hike that takes effect in the new year as the government shores up coffers ahead of an expected surge in social spending in the rapidly ageing city-state in the years ahead.
articles.title: Singapore readies sales tax hike as demographic crunch looms

articles.author: Greg Bensinger
articles.description: General Motors has sued the city of San Francisco, seeking to recover more than $100 million, alleging that it was charged a higher tax bill than warranted because its Cruise self-driving car unit was improperly used to make the calculations.
articles.title: GM sues San Francisco, seeking $121 million in back taxes, penalties

articles.author: Harry Robertson
articles.description: A huge two-month rally in bond prices, powered by expectations that central banks will soon be cutting interest rates, has rescued fixed income markets from an almost unheard-of third straight year of declines.
articles.title: Biggest two-month rally in decades rescues beaten-up bond markets

articles.author: Phil Stewart, David Latona, Angelo Amante
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden hoped to present a firm international response to Yemen's Houthi attacks on Red Sea shipping by launching a new maritime force, but a week after its launch many allies don't want to be associated with it, publicly, or at all.
articles.title: US allies reluctant on Red Sea task force

articles.author: Yimou Lee
articles.description: China has pressured an influential Taiwanese rock band called Mayday to make pro-China comments ahead of Taiwan's key elections next month, according to sources with direct knowledge of the situation and a Taiwan security note reviewed by Reuters.
articles.title: China pressures influential Taiwanese band ahead of elections - sources

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Iran's Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei led prayers on Thursday at the funeral of Sayyed Razi Mousavi, a senior Revolutionary Guards (IRGC) adviser killed in what Iran said was an Israeli air strike in Syria.
articles.title: Iran's supreme leader leads funeral prayers for senior Guards adviser

articles.author: Soo-Hyang Choi
articles.description: North Korea leader Kim Jong Un has ordered his country's military, munitions industry and nuclear weapons sector to accelerate war preparations to counter what he called unprecedented confrontational moves by the U.S., state media said on Thursday.
articles.title: North Korea's Kim orders military to accelerate war preparations
